Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Kinetic Energy, KE
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: KE is the energy due to translational motion of the system as a whole relative to some frame of reference or to the rotation of the system about some axis. It's and extensive property.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Potential Energy, PE
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: PE is the energy due to the position of the system in a potential field. It's an extensive property.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Internal Energy, U

variables.\\Delta U: Change in internal energy of a CLOSED SYSTEM.
variables.Q: Heat (Defined to be + when it is transferred to the system from the surroundings)
variables.W: Work (Defined to be + when work is done by system)

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Internal energy is the total microscopic energy contained within a system, arising from the kinetic and potential energies of its molecules. According to the first law of thermodynamics, the change in internal energy (ΔU) of a closed system equals the heat added to the system (Q) minus the work done by the system (W).

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Work (W)
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Work is the energy transferred to or from a system when it expands or contracts under pressure. It is calculated as the area under the pressure-volume (P-V) curve. In a quasi-static process, the work done by the system is given by the integral of pressure (P) with respect to volume (v) from the initial volume (v₁) to the final volume (v₂). Positive work corresponds to energy leaving the system when it expands, and negative work corresponds to energy entering the system when it is compressed.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: First Law of Thermodynamics

variables.H: Enthalpy of the system (H = U + PV)

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: The First Law of Thermodynamics states that the energy added to a system as heat (Q) minus the work done by the system (W) equals the total change in the system's energy. This includes changes in enthalpy (H), kinetic energy (½ m(v₂² - v₁²)), and potential energy (mg(z₂ - z₁)). It is essentially a statement of conservation of energy, accounting for all forms of energy transfer in a system.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Enthalpy (H)
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Enthalpy is a thermodynamic quantity representing the total heat content of a system. It combines the system's internal energy (U) with the energy associated with its pressure and volume (PV). Enthalpy is especially useful for processes occurring at constant pressure, where the change in enthalpy (ΔH) equals the heat added to or removed from the system.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Flow Work and Shaft Work

variables.\\dot{W}: Total rate of work done on or by the system
variables.\\dot{W_s}: Shaft work (mechanical work done by a rotating shaft)
variables.\\dot{W_{fl}}: Flow work (work required to push mass into or out of a control volume)

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: In a control volume, the total work rate W is the sum of shaft work Ws and flow work Wfl. Shaft work is mechanical work done by devices such as turbines or pumps, while flow work represents the energy required to move fluid into or out of the system against pressure. This distinction is important in analyzing energy transfer in open systems.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: The Open-System Energy Balance

variables.\\Delta \\dot{H}: Change in the specific rate of enthalpy
variables.\\Delta \\dot{E_k}: Change in the rate of Kinetic Energy
variables.\\Delta \\dot{E_p}: Chnage in the rate of POtential Energy
variables.\\dot{Q}: Rate of heat in/out of the system
variables.\\dot{W_s}: Rate of shaft work in/out of the system

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: This states that, 'The net rate at which energy is transferred to a system as heat and/or shaft work equals the difference between the rates at which the quantity (enthalpy + kinetic energy + potential energy) is transported into and out of the system.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Material Balance for a Steady-State Process

variables.\\dot{m}_{in}: Mass flow rate into the system
variables.\\dot{m}_{out}: Mass flow rate out of the system

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: For a system at steady-state, the total mass entering equals the total mass leaving the system.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Overall Material Balance with Accumulation

variables.\\dot{m}_{in}: Mass flow rate into the system
variables.\\dot{m}_{out}: Mass flow rate out of the system

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: For unsteady-state processes, the rate of accumulation equals mass in minus mass out.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Component Material Balance

variables.(m_i)_{sys}: Mass of component i in the system
variables.\\dot{m}_{i,in}: Mass flow rate of component i entering
variables.\\dot{m}_{i,out}: Mass flow rate of component i leaving
variables.r_i: Rate of generation/consumption of component i

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Accounts for accumulation, flow, and chemical reaction of a component in a system.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: The Open-System Energy Balance

variables.\\Delta \\dot{H}: Change in the specific rate of enthalpy
variables.\\Delta \\dot{E_k}: Change in the rate of Kinetic Energy
variables.\\Delta \\dot{E_p}: Change in the rate of Potential Energy
variables.\\dot{Q}: Rate of heat in/out of the system
variables.\\dot{W_s}: Rate of shaft work in/out of the system

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: The net rate at which energy is transferred to a system as heat and/or shaft work equals the difference between the rates at which the quantity (enthalpy + kinetic energy + potential energy) is transported into and out of the system.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Closed-System Energy Balance

variables.\\Delta E_{sys}: Change in total energy of the system

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Energy change in a closed system is the net effect of heat and work interactions.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Sensible Heat Calculation

variables.Q: Amount of heat added or removed
variables.C_p: Specific heat capacity at constant pressure

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates the heat added or removed to temperature change in a substance.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Latent Heat Calculation

variables.\\Delta H_{phase}: Latent heat of the phase change

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Heat required for phase transition without temperature change.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Ideal Gas Law
Chemical Process Calculations I.formula: P V = n R T \\,  \\ \rho = \frac{P M}{R T}
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates pressure, volume, temperature, and amount of an ideal gas.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Partial Pressure in Gas Mixtures

variables.y_i: Mole fraction of component i in the gas
variables.P_{total}: Total pressure of the gas mixture

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Partial pressure is proportional to mole fraction in ideal gas mixtures.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Raoult's Law

variables.y_i: Mole fraction of component i in the vapor phase
variables.x_i: Mole fraction of component i in the liquid phase
variables.P_i^*: Vapor pressure of pure component i

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates the partial pressure of a component in the vapor phase to its mole fraction in the liquid phase and its pure-component vapor pressure.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Henry's Law

variables.C_i: Concentration of gas i in liquid
variables.k_H: Henry's constant for the gas-liquid pair
variables.P_i: Partial pressure of the gas above the liquid

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: The solubility of a gas in a liquid is proportional to its partial pressure.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Mole Fraction Calculation

variables.n_i: Number of moles of component i

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Defines mole fraction as the ratio of moles of a component to total moles.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Mass Fraction Calculation
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Defines mass fraction as the ratio of mass of a component to total mass.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Mean Molecular Weight of Gas Mixture
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Weighted average molecular weight based on mole fractions.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Excess Enthalpy for Mixtures
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Accounts for non-ideal enthalpy changes in mixtures.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Energy Balance for Non-Reactive Closed System
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Internal energy change equals net heat minus work.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Polytropic Process
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Describes a process where pressure and volume are related by a polytropic index.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Isothermal Work
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Work done by an ideal gas during an isothermal process.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Adiabatic Work
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Work done by an ideal gas in an adiabatic process.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Change in Enthalpy
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Enthalpy change due to temperature change at constant pressure.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Change in Internal Energy
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Internal energy change due to temperature change at constant volume.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Enthalpy of Mixing

variables.H_i(T): Enthalpy of pure component i at temperature T

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Total enthalpy including ideal and excess contributions for mixtures.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Heat Capacity of a Mixture

variables.C_{p,i}: Heat capacity of pure component i

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Weighted sum of heat capacities of components.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Rate Law for a Chemical Reaction

variables.[A], [B]: Concentration of reactants A and B
variables.m, n: Reaction orders with respect to A and B

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Reaction rate depends on reactant concentrations raised to their respective orders.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Arrhenius Equation
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates reaction rate constant to temperature.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Half-Life for First-Order Reaction
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Time for concentration to drop to half in a first-order reaction.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Half-Life for Second-Order Reaction
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Time for concentration to drop to half in a second-order reaction.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Conversion of Reactant in a Batch Reactor

variables.N_A: Moles of A at time t

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Defines fractional conversion in batch reactions.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Design Equation for a Continuous Stirred Tank Reactor (CSTR)

variables.F_{A0}: Molar flow rate of A into reactor
variables.r_A: Rate of reaction of A (negative for consumption)

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Reactor volume required for a given conversion in a CSTR.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Design Equation for a Plug Flow Reactor (PFR)

variables.F_{A0}: Molar flow rate of A into reactor

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Reactor volume for a PFR based on conversion and reaction rate.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Damkohler Number
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Dimensionless number comparing reaction rate to flow rate.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Mass Transfer Coefficient Relation
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates molar flux to concentration driving force.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Overall Mass Balance in Absorption Column

variables.y_{A,in}, y_{A,out}: Inlet and outlet mole fraction of A in gas

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Mass transfer of a component in an absorption column.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Fick's Law of Diffusion
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Rate of diffusion proportional to concentration gradient.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Material Balance in Distillation
Chemical Process Calculations I.formula: F z_F = V y + L x
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates feed, vapor, and liquid compositions in a distillation stage.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: McCabe-Thiele Step Calculation

variables.y_{n+1}: Vapor mole fraction leaving stage n+1
variables.x_n: Liquid mole fraction entering stage n

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Stepwise calculation of equilibrium stages in binary distillation.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Equilibrium Constant for Gas-Phase Reaction

variables.K_p: Equilibrium constant in terms of partial pressures

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Relates partial pressures at equilibrium for a chemical reaction.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Gibbs Free Energy Relation
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Predicts direction of reaction and equilibrium position.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium (VLE) with Raoult's Law
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Non-ideal VLE accounting for activity coefficients.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Enthalpy of Reaction

variables.\\nu_p, \\nu_r: Stoichiometric coefficients of products and reactants

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Difference between enthalpies of products and reactants.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Overall Heat Transfer Rate
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Heat transfer through a surface in steady-state.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Log Mean Temperature Difference (LMTD)

variables.\\Delta T_2: Temperature difference at the other end

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Used in calculating heat transfer for counter/parallel flow exchangers.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Pressure Drop in Pipe (Darcy-Weisbach)
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Pressure loss due to friction in a pipe.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Reynolds Number
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Dimensionless number determining flow regime (laminar or turbulent).

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Sherwood Number for Mass Transfer
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Dimensionless number for convective mass transfer.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Overall Material Balance with Reaction
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Overall balance for reactive system at steady state.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Gas Constant (R) Values
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: The gas constant (R) has multiple units depending on the system of measurement:

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Gas Constant Units
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: These values represent the gas constant in various unit systems.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Conversion between Mass Flow Rate and Molar Flow Rate
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts mass flow rate to molar flow rate using the molar mass of the substance.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Conversion between Molar Flow Rate and Mass Flow Rate
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts molar flow rate to mass flow rate using the molar mass of the substance.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Volumetric Flow Rate from Molar Flow Rate (Ideal Gas)
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts molar flow rate to volumetric flow rate for ideal gases using the ideal gas law.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Molar Flow Rate from Volumetric Flow Rate (Ideal Gas)
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts volumetric flow rate to molar flow rate for ideal gases using the ideal gas law.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Volumetric Flow Rate from Mass Flow Rate
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts mass flow rate to volumetric flow rate using the fluid density.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Mass Flow Rate from Volumetric Flow Rate
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts volumetric flow rate to mass flow rate using the fluid density.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Celsius to Kelvin
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Celsius to Kelvin by adding 273.15.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Kelvin to Celsius
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Kelvin to Celsius by subtracting 273.15.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Fahrenheit to Rankine
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Fahrenheit to Rankine by adding 459.67.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Rankine to Fahrenheit
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Rankine to Fahrenheit by subtracting 459.67.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Rankine to Kelvin
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Rankine to Kelvin using the ratio 5/9.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Kelvin to Rankine
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Kelvin to Rankine using the ratio 9/5.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Celsius to Fahrenheit
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Celsius to Fahrenheit using the linear relation.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Fahrenheit to Celsius
Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Converts Fahrenheit to Celsius using the linear relation.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Mole Fraction of a Component

variables.n_i: Number of moles of component i
variables.n_j: Number of moles of component j
variables.n: Total number of components in the mixture

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Calculates the mole fraction of a component in a mixture. Mole fractions are widely used in chemical engineering to relate composition to thermodynamic and transport properties.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Density of a Liquid Mixture Using Mass Fractions

variables.w_i: Mass fraction of component i in the mixture (dimensionless)
variables.n: Number of components in the mixture

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Calculates the density of a liquid mixture using the mass fractions and densities of the individual components. Useful for multi-component solutions where volumetric changes are negligible.

Chemical Process Calculations I.name: Density of a Liquid Mixture Using Mole Fractions

variables.n: Number of components in the mixture

Chemical Process Calculations I.description: Calculates the density of a liquid mixture using mole fractions. The numerator sums the contributions of each component's molar mass, while the denominator sums the contributions of each component's molar volume. Assumes ideal mixing (no volume contraction).
